column5: I am heading to Mirond Lake May 23 for 9 day trip. Any suggestions on techniques, baits, good or bad areas or any other advice. Thanks in advance.
Here's a search on Walleye Central. https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...rchid=20321890 If you want more info from my trips there(last was -in the late 1980's, I think), email me. Bill

If you want big fish you have to navigate to the north end of the lake. I would suggest a guide for at least the first day. We used Hubert Ballentyne and was awesome. Took us to the SPOTS. Knows the lake well. If your bringing your boat, make sure to bring a few extra Aluminum props. I was careful and spent $700 on repairs when I got home. Awesome pretty lake for sure!Have fun, 9 days is about perfect. we went for 5 last year and it wasn't long enough. One of my favorite lakes...Cheers

We are headed up to Mirond in the middle of June, so I'm looking forward to hearing how you guys didWe have fished that lake 5 or 6 times and always done well. Spoons/Cranks/Rogues have worked great for the pike and jigs for the walleye. We have caught big pike 40"+ and average walleye.Let us know how the fishing was when you return, thanks
